responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Path Traversal in getFilenameFromUrl
    analysis: |
      The function `getFilenameFromUrl` in `src/utils/getFilenameFromUrl.js` is vulnerable to a path traversal attack.

      An attacker can supply a specially crafted URL containing sequences like `..%2f` or `..%5c` which, after unescaping in `querystring.unescape(pathname)`, will resolve to parent directories. By appending further path components, an attacker can escape the intended output directory and read arbitrary files from the system.
    cwe: CWE-22
    function_names:
      - getFilenameFromUrl
    filenames:
      - src/utils/getFilenameFromUrl.js
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Path Traversal in getFilenameFromUrl
leads.analysis:
The function getFilenameFromUrl in src/utils/getFilenameFromUrl.js is vulnerable to a path traversal attack.

An attacker can supply a specially crafted URL containing sequences like ..%2f or ..%5c which, after unescaping in querystring.unescape(pathname), will resolve to parent directories. By appending further path components, an attacker can escape the intended output directory and read arbitrary files from the system.
